definition: to quarrel/to bicker/glib repartee
abbr. for the Big Dipper constellation 北斗星[Bei3 dou3 xing1]
to fight/to struggle/to condemn/to censure/to contend/to put together/coming together
variant of 鬭|斗[dou4]
dry measure for grain equal to ten 升[sheng1] or one-tenth of a 石[dan4]/decaliter/peck/cup or dipper shaped object/old variant of 陡[dou3]
variant of 鬥|斗[dou4]
variant of 鬥|斗[dou4]
mouth/beak/nozzle/spout (of teapot etc)/CL:張|张[zhang1],個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: We can't take you seriously when you just bandy words.
sentences.chinese: 当你们仅仅是互相斗嘴时我们不能当真。

sentences.english: They bickered and got on each other's cases, sure.
sentences.chinese: 他们斗嘴而且上彼此情形，当然。

sentences.english: Vindictive little men and women squabble, with a different kind of relationship.
sentences.chinese: 小男女斗嘴斗气，有了一种别样的关系。

sentences.english: Whenever the phone rings they bicker over who must answer it.
sentences.chinese: 每当电话铃响起，他们就斗嘴，谁必须回答。

sentences.english: They split up, spread out, sunned themselves, bickered.
sentences.chinese: 他们闹翻，舒展身躯晒太阳，他们斗嘴。

sentences.english: These squabbling Tolstoys and their stilted histrionics were conceited and exasperating.
sentences.chinese: 这些斗嘴的托尔斯泰们和他们夸张的表演真令人恼火。

sentences.english: At this scene, he was bickering with his aunt.
sentences.chinese: 在他与姨妈斗嘴的那一幕里。

sentences.english: The two children were always bickering with each other over small matters.
sentences.chinese: 这两个孩子总是为些小事斗嘴。

sentences.english: The New-year bells are wrangling with the snow.
sentences.chinese: 新年的钟声在跟雪花斗嘴。

definition: to bicker/to squabble/to quarrel
to quarrel
to bicker/to argue for the sake of arguing/to carry on poles (together with sb else)/to carry a coffin on poles
to banter
to be difficult with sb/to provoke disagreement/at loggerheads/to fall out with
to show off/to put on a show to amuse others
to sulk/to squabble
to tease a woman by pretending to be displeased with her/to flirt with a member of the opposite sex/to banter flirtatiously
(coll.) to wag one's tongue/to indulge in idle gossip and silly jokes/to chatter endlessly/to speak glibly
talkative/garrulous/loquacious/flippant/jocular
to include impromptu comic material in opera performance (idiom); to jest/buffoonery
to quarrel/to have a row/quarrel/CL:頓|顿[dun4]
to hurl abuse/to trade insults/slanging match
to fight/to scuffle/to come to blows/CL:場|场[chang2]
to quarrel/dispute
(of a couple) to be sweet to each other/lovey-dovey/variant of 膩味|腻味[ni4 wei5]
